column4: 'doesn't work' is a vague statement, please explain in detail about how, error messages, etc.
when booting from the hard drive (freshly installed ubuntu 11.04), it runs extremely slow (about 20secs to load grub bootloader)
set hard drive as the first device to boot
does it run smoothly after grub loaded?
but its grub itself that runs so slow...when I press "e" to edit a grub line, this takes additional 20 seconds to open the edit screen
no, operating system runs equally slow
so slow you can't work with it...some minutes to boot (insteal of 20 seconds), 20 seconds to start a terminal, 10 more seconds to get a prompt..
when I remove one memory module (doesnt matter which one) it runs perfectly fast
but the speed seems to be normal when running memtest?
that is a good question..don't know how fast memtest usually is..but it appeared normal to me
memtest prints out memory speed, cache speed, etc.
oh okay..then maybe I should do a little comparison
I wonder if there are different methods that linux/grub can access system memory
will also try to install a different OS and see if that one runs okay
also, try to rearrange order of memory modules, mismatching speed, or gap in address space?
I already physically switched memory modules, with no change in result
